Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial on Medium-Term Restenosis Rates in Carotid Endarterectomy with Biological vs. Synthetic Patches

Trial_Design.evidence: This single-centre retrospective study identified all primary CEA with patch angioplasty performed between 2007 and 2019 at a university hospital.

Participants.evidence: Participants included patients with symptomatic or asymptomatic 50–99% internal carotid artery stenosis.

Intervention.evidence: Bovine pericardium served as the biological patch, while Dacron, ePTFE, and polyester-urethane were synthetic comparators.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was moderate (50–69%) and critical (70–99%) restenosis, defined by duplex ultrasonography criteria.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 127 CEAs were analysed, with 75 using bovine pericardium.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 127 CEAs were analysed, with 75 using bovine pericardium.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Bovine patches were significantly associated with >50% restenosis (p = 0.042) but not >70% (p = 0.197).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included neck haematomas (2.1%), patch infections (1.4%), and patch thrombosis (1.4%).
